images.description: Map of Ukraine as of 31 December 2023

casualties_and_losses.description: Reports vary widely, see Casualties section for details.

overview.description: The invasion began on 24 February 2022 as an escalation of the ongoing Russo-Ukrainian War. It has caused tens of thousands of civilian casualties and hundreds of thousands of military casualties. Russia occupied about 20% of Ukrainian territory by June 2022. The war has led to a major refugee crisis and extensive environmental damage.

key_events.event: Russian troops retreat from the northern front.
Russia captures Mariupol after a destructive siege.
Ukraine launches successful counteroffensives in the south and east.
Ukraine launches another counteroffensive in the southeast.

international_response.condemnation: The invasion was met with international condemnation including a UN General Assembly resolution and sanctions against Russia and Belarus.
international_response.humanitarian_and_military_aid: Many countries provided humanitarian and military aid to Ukraine.
international_response.protests: Global protests occurred, and over 1,000 companies closed operations in Russia and Belarus due to the invasion.

legal_actions.ICC_investigations: The International Criminal Court opened investigations into possible crimes against humanity, war crimes, abduction of children, and genocide.
legal_actions.arrest_warrant: The court issued an arrest warrant for Putin and Maria Lvova-Belova in March 2023.

summary: The Russian invasion of Ukraine is an ongoing conflict that began in February 2022. It has resulted in significant casualties, territorial changes, and a major refugee crisis. The invasion has been widely condemned internationally, and it has led to various legal and political actions against Russia.
